meanings.sent1: She kept dithering about which movie to watch.
meanings.sent2: He was dithering between the blue shirt and the red one.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was dithering back and forth on the tree branch, unable to decide which way to go.
meanings.sent4: The dithering clouds in the sky seemed unable to make up their minds about raining.
meanings.sent5: Her constant dithering made it impossible to make any plans with her.

meanings.sent1: The student was dithering outside the exam room, worried about the test.
meanings.sent2: She dithered before making the phone call, unsure of what to say.
meanings.sent3: The cat was dithering around the new dog, unsure if it was friend or foe.
meanings.sent4: The dithering bird hesitated before taking flight from the branch.
meanings.sent5: His constant dithering made his friends anxious to make plans with him.

meanings.definition: A state of indecision or uncertainty.
meanings.sent1: The dithering in her mind made it hard to focus on the task at hand.
meanings.sent2: The team was in a state of dithering about which strategy to choose.
meanings.sent3: The dithering in the courtroom was palpable as the jury deliberated.
meanings.sent4: The dithering of the stock market caused many investors to panic.
meanings.sent5: The dithering of the compass needle left the hikers lost in the woods.
